communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Alexandria VA
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to request the contract that the district entered into with a vendor for the stop arm camera pilot (50 buses). 

Additionally any applicable intergovernmental agreements with the City of Alexandria and/or the police department for the enforcement of school bus stop arm camera violations. 

Lastly, any records related to the procurement of the vendor stop-arm camera contract.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Jon Smith.

title: University of Minnesota Police LRAD use against protestors

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: University of Minnesota Police LRAD use against protestors
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

In February 2026, multiple independent, local, and national news outlets published photographs and reporting regarding so-called “noise demonstrations” occurring on or near the University of Minnesota campus. Reporting and photographic evidence indicate that the University of Minnesota Police Department (UMPD) responded to several of these events and, in at least some instances, deployed a Long-Range Acoustical Device (LRAD). Multiple publicly available images show an LRAD device connected to a UMPD vehicle.

Accordingly, I request the following records:
1. LRAD Acquisition Records: All purchase orders, invoices, receipts, contracts, grant documentation, vendor correspondence, and related procurement records for any LRAD devices currently or previously in the possession of UMPD, including but not limited to devices manufactured by LRAD Corporation / Genasys, and including models such as the LRAD 500X.
--
2. LRAD Training and Operational Materials: All manuals, training documents, lesson plans, presentations (including PowerPoint or equivalent), standard operating procedures, quick-reference guides, safety warnings, or other instructional materials that describe, govern, or advise UMPD personnel on the operation, deployment, configuration, volume settings, warnings, or tactical use of LRAD devices.
--
3. Policies Governing Use of Force and Crowd Control: All current and historical UMPD policies, directives, or guidelines governing: Use of force, Crowd control or protest response, Deployment of less-lethal or acoustic devices, Escalation or authorization requirements for specialized equipment.
--
4. Deployment and After-Action Records (February 2026)
Any after-action reports, incident reports, operational summaries, or internal reviews referencing LRAD use during protests or demonstrations in February 2026 (Feb 1 - Feb 9), including records that identify: Date(s) and location(s) of deployment, Authorizing personnel, Purpose and duration of use.
--
If any portion of this request is unclear or requires clarification to facilitate a timely response, I am happy to confer.

Thank you for your time and assistance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alan J. Segal

title: Thaxter McKnight Incident Report and Case File

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting documents from the Birmingham Police Department (specifically its cold case unit)  regarding the death of Thaxter McKnight, who was found dead of a gunshot wound in his Crestwood home in Birmingham, Alabama, on Jan. 23, 2002. I  request the following files and will accept any that are available to me.

- Full and complete case file regarding the death of Thaxter McKnight
- Initial incident report - Any and all audio and video files related to the case
- Photographs or visual evidence related to the case
- Witness statements and interviews
- Family and acquaintance interviews and statements
- Field notes

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Courteney Stuart.
